text: Kidland is a former civil parish, now in the parish of Alwinton in Northumberland, England, about northwest of Alwinton village. In 1951 the parish had a population of 58. == History == From 1856 Kidland was a civil parish in its own right until it was merged with Alwinton on 1 April 1955. == Governance == Kidland is in the parliamentary constituency of Berwick-upon- Tweed. == References == == External links == * GENUKI (Accessed: 3 December 2008) Category:Former civil parishes in Northumberland
title: Kidland
